headline: Candied Carrots
description: These candied carrots are made with tender, boiled carrots cooked in a buttery brown sugar sauce until glazed for a colorful, crowd-pleasing side.

video.description: See how to make sautéed carrots in a simple brown sugar and butter glaze.
video.name: Candied Carrots

name: Candied Carrots
recipeIngredient: 1 pound carrots, cut into 2 inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Place carrots in a pot of salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a low boil and cook until tender but not mushy, 20 to 30 minutes. Drain and return carrots to the pot.
Place the pot with carrots over the lowest possible heat setting. Stir in brown sugar, butter, salt, and pepper. Cook until sugar is bubbly, 3 to 5 minutes. Serve hot.

review.reviewBody: I cut mine in 2" pieces and then in half lengthwise and cooked less. Twenty minutes for whole carrots would still be too long for our tastes. I used less brown sugar for taste, the hubbs loved them whereas he normally isn't a fan. He even had leftovers. Will make these again!
No changes. Very easy to follow directions, tastes so good. Had a friend over she loved them as well

10/10 recommend! I used a bag of baby carrots cut lengthwise. Followed other reviewers and steamed - only took about 10 mins. I doubled the butter and brown sugar cause I wanted extra sauce to dip Easter ham in. Simmered about 10 minutes. I also added a dash of both cinnamon and red pepper flakes (other reviewers recommended) and it was amazing! Sweet and a little spicy. I’ll make these often - they were so easy and different from ordinary veggies!
Cook as directed IF YOU LIKE MUSHY CARROTS. WAY TOO LONG COOKING
Quick and simple. They are so good!
My family’s favorite carrot recipe! No leftovers no matter how much I make!
Hubby absolutely loves carrots this way. I am making them again for Thanksgiving this year!

Made this last night for Thanksgiving (Canada celebrates in October) dinner using carrots I had harvested from our garden. It was super delicious and extremely easy to make. It was the hit of the dinner with everyone commenting on them and asking for the receipt
My kids love these!! A sweet fun way to add carrots to any meal. Big hit at family dinners too!
I thought this recipe was well balanced in buttery sweetness and salt. It was easy to make and it will stay in my recipe box for future use.
Like grandma’s recipe. Just one thing grandma added this recipe didn’t add is a tap of vanilla.

Followed the recipe, but added some agave syrup. Made it much better. I agree with others in that I wish the glaze was a little thicker, so next go around I’ll have to amend the recipe to make a thicker glaze.
This recipe was really good. I've recently tried other candied/glazed carrot recipes and my husband didn't like them. This one, however, he really enjoyed. It was so simple and delicious.
Super easy and the entire family loves it!
Simple and delicious!

very good and very easy, well that is until I called mom, she said her mom used a small spoonful of molasses as well, and she was right, also used no pepper, just a little sea salt. PERFECT! thankyou for this easy sidedish when you are in a crunch for time. served them at thanksgiving, everyone tore them up, had a little leftovers too I was gonna hide for myself, but nope! the partner spied them while doing dishes and they dissapeared.
Good Recipe! I added a little more Brown sugar & butter & a dash of Vanilla. This is almost dessert! Definitely worth cooking!
It worked out great
It was easy and delicious

Followed the recipe exactly. Very easy and hubby loved them; I however feel they are lacking that extra something, so may try again with some modifications as noted in others reviews. Regardless, will definitely have this in my recipe rotation from now on
These were Delicious and simple to make.
So easy and so good! Thanks
Very good flavor and simple to make.
Yummy
Yum.
I really liked this! It’s good anytime but I think it will become a staple at Thanksgiving. Very easy to make!
These came out delicious. Next time I need to double the receipt they were gone so fast!!
Wouldn’t change anything! They were a hit!
Not mushy enough for my taste but everyone else thought it was good.
I love candied carrots. I follow my mother's lead and will usually add about 2 teaspoons of chopped fresh mint at the butter/sugar stage. Delicious!
Amazing!!! So easy and simple. Definitely saved it!
Absolutely wonderful! Huge hit with my boys :)
Way too sweet for my taste.
I followed the recipe but I used 2 pounds of carrots, so I doubled the butter and brown sugar! Delicious!

Wonderful. Used baby carrots as some others did. Didn't need to change anything. Made a batch of these, and ate some and vacuum packed the rest. They reheat perfectly. I just toss the bags into boiling water. No change in flavor. Perfect make ahaead for the holidays. Thank you.
Delicious! Subbed 1/2 the brown sugar for Splenda brown sugar to decrease calories. Love this recipe!!!

The only reason I rated this 4/5 was that my wife does not particularly like candied carrots; maybe next time I'll call it "savory carrots", she does not know the difference. EASY recipe and great with strong meats (had it with venision). You can decide which sweetener you want to use; I used honey with a touch of molasses. Cook it down to desired consistency but DON'T overcook the carrots. Fresh dill makes a huge difference if you like.
These candied carrots came out totally finger licking good! My family totally loved them and asked if I can make it again tomorrow for dinner.
So easy, so delicious. It had just the right amount of sweet from the brown sugar. I'll definitely make this again!
My family loved this recipe. I only added two more spices to it. Freshly grated nutmeg and freshly grated cinnamon.
easy and delicious!
Made it just as the recipe stated. Received rave reviews. Will definitely make it again. So simple.

Yes I did make changes to the recipe. I sliced my carrots via the vegetable cutter on my stand mixer. Everyone liked the carrots being sliced a lot smaller than the recipe. I used everything else just as it was. Oh the compliments we c got!
It wasn't so bad. I thought the kids would like it since it's all sweet and all but they didn't. I'll probably still make it again.
Very good.. had to cook a little longer to get the glaze..
My entire family truly enjoyed eating this dish and everyone rated it a "5." I will definitely make this dish again and again as this was mighty tasty and we cannot say enough about this dish.

I like this recipe it was easy to make, and a fast side. I
cut the carrots up ahead. I added cinnamon and basil. 
I used baby carrots and cut them in half. Very tasty!
Very easy and yummy and I don't like cooked carrots but these are great. It took the bitterness away that I typically experience with cooked carrots!
These are always delicious with a savory main dish. I like to add a little cornstarch so it’s not so runny on the plate.
Very good, family loved them.
Made it as written. Will definitely make again!
Everyone loved these carrots.
Delicious and extremely easy! Even my meat & potatoes eater ate them & said they were the best carrots he'd ever had.
Easy and simple to make and tasty .
Turned out great! Will make again.
This was a last minute addition to Thanksgiving dinner. It turn out great! I too turn up the heat a little higher to get the butter and brown sugar mixture to thicken. Simple and quick side dish!
Added a little orange zest to the recipe gave it a little kick it was really tasty happy I found the recipe ??
The only thing I added was a splash of vanilla extract. I'm sure it would have been great without it as well.
These are great!
This recipe is a keeper! My husband loves carrots and he loved this recipe. I really don't care for cooked carrots and I thought this recipe made carrots fairly tolerable.

Didn’t have to make any changes whatsoever. I have 2 children who cant stand eating vegetables, but saw this recipe and figured I’d try it. I talked My daughter, who didn’t even want to try it, in to eating just one. She ate the rest of the pot. I told her I was glad she tried it and liked it. She replied.....well now that you made it unhealthy, I’ll eat it!!!!

Can’t wait to make it again
Made with peeled baby carrots. Only made a 1/2 pound, turned out great! Even my non-vegetable eating teenage boy ate a few! Thanks for sharing! :)
My family and I loved it! It was absolutely delicious, to say the least!

I made it but ran out of time and did not let it cook enough after adding the sugar. I actually was planning on leftovers since my daughter & her husband do not liked cooked carrots. They decided to try them along with my grandson. After the first bite, they disappeared. They asked for more next week. All my grandsons will be here so I'm thinking I will plan better so they get cooked correctly and I will triple the recipe :-)
I made it according to the recipe. It was very good. I will make it again.
I loved this recipe. The key for me is making sure I don't bail the carrots too much.
Very easy & tasty
My family and I loved it! Can't stop making it!

Made this for dinner tonight. My husband is on a renal diet so I used unsalted butter & left the salt out of the recipe entirely. Even with that he loved these carrots. I also doubled the sauce hoping it would give him A major win because he doesn’t normally eat carrots! Adding this recipe to my A+ list.
Fantastic and easy, added 1/8th cup of bourbon and it’s even better
It was very good! I think 1/4 cup is too much brown sugar for my taste. I just added a little brown sugar and taste it before I kept adding more.
Very good and simple to make.

I come from a family that always prepared and served canned vegetables. I never, in all my adult life, purchased and prepared canned carrots because they are always too mushy and bland. I have used this recipe a total of four times and I keep coming back to it. It is wonderful and I thank you for sharing this.
Finally got around to reviewing and photographing this recipe that I have been making for years. I use baby carrots, boiling them for 10-12 minutes. They are absolutely delicious#
Made these for Christmas dinner with the whole family. Everyone loved them, even the kids! I will definitely make these again!
Delishes !!!!

This is the only way I can eat carrots other than just sautéed in butter. I went by the recipe but next time, I will add a little more brown sugar and butter. I also will cook it longer until the glaze is set.
I was wondering how to make these I forgot. Made these they were great!

Made for potluck. Didn't add salt pepper. But a dash of cinnamon like another reviewer suggested.
Was well liked by kids & adults.
Quick, easy and good!
Easy and delicious!
Very easy to make and very delicious!
Excellent!
Will definitely make this again. Amount was just right, served at a dinner for 8.
Simply easy and delicious

Excellent results with minimal effort! I had some carrots that were on the way out, and this was great to salvage them. I followed some of the reviews and sliced on the diagonal ~1/4", boiled for 2-3 min, then moved to a frying pan that had the rest of the ingredients melted in it. I continually stirred for a only a few minutes, and they got nice and coated with the glaze. Delicious!
I don't like cooked carrots, but I loved these.
I have a picky eater daughter, who cleaned her plate. Absolutely delicious.
I tried candied carrots in a restaurant some time ago and always wanted to figure out how to duplicate it. This came very close. I loved it and decided to make it one of my favorites.
I made it just the way it is and it came out good. Will make this again
I liked it a lot and instead of black pepper I used cayenne and based it off of Wendy's candied pecans.
Popular with my guests. Will make again
These carrots are so good, easy to make and delicious. Will definitely make them again.

These carrots were DELICIOUS!!!!! I prepared 2 lbs as directed but only sugared half of them as my husband doesn't really care for sweet vegetables. 
I give him some of each, buttered and the sugared.
He requested more of the sweetened version, so I added the rest to the candied sauce! Very very good! Very, very easy!!! Will definitely be making these again!!!!!
Followed the recipe as written and was well received. Will make this again and again.
Easy and delicious! A great addition to our Easter menu.

Very quick & easy to make! I boiled the carrots and prepped my sautéed pan ahead a time. When it came time to serve dinner I quickly sautéed the carrots in the brown sugar & butter. A hit amongst adults but not with the 5 children (ages 8, 6, 6, & 4), surprising but I will definitely make these again. I really enjoyed them:)
Children and Adults loved them.
Made like the recipe. Only used 1 lb of carrots. It was very easy and got lots of compliments
